casebody.data:
SKINNER et al.
v.
PREFERRED CREDIT et al. No. 525A05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. February 23, 2006. Gary K. Shipman, William G. Wright, Wilmington, A. Holt Rowell, III, Daniel Myers, Mt. Pleasant, SC, Eric G. Calhoun, Dallas, TX, for Skinners, et al. Hada V. Haulsee, Ronald R. Davis, Bradley R. Johnson, Winston-Salem, for Preferred Credit Trust. Robert R. Marcus, Angela L. Little, Greensboro, Daniel J. Tobin, for Impac Funding. Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Solicitor General, Gary R. Govert, Special Deputy Attorney General, for Attorney General. Seth P. Rosebrock, for CRL. Carlene McNulty, for N.C. Justice Center. Kenneth L. Schorr, Charlotte, for LSSP. William J. Whalen, for Pisgah Legal Services. Susan Gottsegen, Winston-Salem, for LASNNC. Maria D. McIntyre, Charlotte, for FPLC. Robert A. Singer, Kathleen Gleason, Greensboro, for NC Bankers Asso.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 22nd day of February 2006 by NC Bankers Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 23rd day of February 2006."
